description: Manage (add, remove, change) individual settings in an INI-style file without having to manage the file as a whole with, say, M(template) or M(assemble). Adds missing sections if they don't exist.
author: Jan-Piet Mens
notes: While it is possible to add an I(option) without specifying a I(value), this makes no sense.

examples.code: ini_file dest=/etc/conf section=drinks option=fav value=lemonade mode=0600 backup=true
examples.description: Ensure C(fav=lemonade) is in section C([drinks]) in said file

examples.code:
ini_file dest=/etc/anotherconf
         section=drinks
         option=temperature
         value=cold
         backup=true

description: if set (required for changing a I(value)), this is the name of the option.
May be omitted if adding/removing a whole I(section).
all arguments accepted by the M(file) module also work here
Path to the INI-style file; this file is created if required
Section name in INI file. This is added if C(state=present) automatically when a single value is being set.
Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.
the string value to be associated with an I(option). May be omitted when removing an I(option).
